alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 9:01AM CDT until May 28 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Mccook 1se affecting Red Willow County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nebraska... Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Nebraska...Kansas... Beaver Creek At Cedar Bluffs affecting Red Willow and Decatur Counties. Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw affecting Red Willow County. For the Republican River...including Mccook 1se...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Republican River At Mccook 1se. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Lowland areas will become flooded. Barnett Park will become inundated. At 10.0 feet, Flooding could become severe in nearby locations. The depth of the water could reach a foot in Barnett Park and other low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CDT Saturday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a secondary crest of 9.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 07/29/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1000 AM CDT.
